channel.title: .bat to .sh conversion please
channel.description:
I really need help. I finally found out how to install JDK onto my Ubuntu VPS, but I can't find out how to convert my batch into a .sh so I can run it.
Can anyone please covert this into Linux .sh
[code]@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx1400m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server start Run-Server.bat exit[/code]
And if you could tell me exactly where to put it, and what to type into terminal, that would be great. Please and Thank you so much.

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please
item.dc:creator: @Siggi Siggi
item.description:
@Siggi wrote:

t4:

DARWIN LINUX OS YOU SAY???

Oops I meant UNIX. lol

Read full topic

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

Siggi:

I’m a pro at this since I have a Mac, which is based on the Darwin Linux OS. (iOS, which iPhones, iPads, iPods run on, also is based on Darwin)

Darwin Linux OS rofl the darwin OS has no code relation to Linux whatsoever, it’s based partly upon BSD which in turn is based upon the original UNIX src. since Linux is effectively a UNIX clone, it has a lot of similarities with OS X but it is completely its own codebase.

edit: also ‘pro’ lol ok

[quote=“Siggi, post:10, topic:449150”]#!/bin/sh cd "`dirname "$0"`" java -Xmx1400m -cp bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server

When converting from Windows to Mac/Linux code you MUST change semi colons ; to colons : The other guy above didn’t make that change, which is why it probably didn’t work properly.[/quote]i completely forgot about that step, but the actual error caused was from the carriage return line-ending, that problem would have popped up afterwards (if the jvm doesn’t assume ;s as : on linux)

Read full topic

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please

[quote=“t4, post:11, topic:449150”][quote author=Siggi link=topic=552048.msg4048609#msg4048609 date=1342290329]
I’m a pro at this since I have a Mac, which is based on the Darwin Linux OS. (iOS, which iPhones, iPads, iPods run on, also is based on Darwin)

#!/bin/sh cd "`dirname "$0"`" java -Xmx1400m -cp bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server

When converting from Windows to Mac/Linux code you MUST change semi colons ; to colons : The other guy above didn’t make that change, which is why it probably didn’t work properly.
[/quote]DARWIN LINUX OS YOU SAY???[/quote]

PRO AT THIS YOU SAY?
:eek: :rolleyes: :o ;D

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please
item.dc:creator: @Siggi Siggi
item.description:
@Siggi wrote:

I’m a pro at this since I have a Mac, which is based on the Darwin UNIX OS. (iOS, which iPhones, iPads, iPods run on, also is based on Darwin)

#!/bin/sh cd "`dirname "$0"`" java -Xmx1400m -cp bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar server.Server

When converting from Windows to Mac/Linux code you MUST change semi colons ; to colons : The other guy above didn’t make that change, which is why it probably didn’t work properly.

Read full topic

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

nano should convert line endings if you change save formats (Unix vs MS-DOS)

Read full topic

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Yeah, it looks like the file was saved with a windows-style line encoding (10, 13) instead of Unix-like (10).

Easiest fix would be to copy the contents, in linux/unix and paste it into the file.

It should just copy the contents, with the system default line separator.

Read full topic

uh, you don’t have BaSH installed?.. use /bin/sh instead then.
[/quote]or ^M is a carriage return which the system doesn’t like!![/quote]
oh, i didn’t see that

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[code=bash]#!/bin/bash

java -Xmx1400m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
[/code]
save as server.sh. i’m not sure what the start Run-Server.bat is, it seems redundant anyhow because the java invocation should run the server

then in the terminal to make the script executable (don’t type the dollar sign)

to run the script

edit: if you want to actually get somewhere with a VPS, i’d recommend learning to use it

Read full topic

item.title: .bat to .sh conversion please

item.description:
@zosai wrote:

I really need help. I finally found out how to install JDK onto my Ubuntu VPS, but I can’t find out how to convert my batch into a .sh so I can run it.

@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx1400m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server start Run-Server.bat exit

And if you could tell me exactly where to put it, and what to type into terminal, that would be great. Please and Thank you so much.
